intro: Primula alba, commonly known as the white primrose, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardeners. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
